text: Pyeongchang station is a railway station in Yongpyeong-myeon, Pyeongchang, South Korea. It is served by the Gyeonggang Line. The station opened on 22 December 2017, ahead of the 2018 Winter Olympics. == Features == This station name is Pyeongchang, but it is more than 20km away from Pyeongchang-eup, and there is a station between Yeongdong Expressway Pyeongchang Crossroad and Seoul National University Pyeongchang campus. == Platform == This station has 2 platforms and 4 tracks. {| class="wikitable" !1·2 | rowspan="2" | Gangneung Line KTX |Jinbu (Odaesan) / for Gangneung |- !3·4 |Dunnae, Cheongnyangni · for Seoul |} == Footnotes == # ↑ Minis (平昌驛) the try of Land, Transport and Communications Notice 2017-428, June 29, 2017. ==References== Category:Buildings and structures in Pyeongchang County Category:Railway stations in Gangwon Province, South Korea Category:Railway stations opened in 2017
title: Pyeongchang station
